Key Match Events: England won by 10 wickets with 24 balls remaining.
England chased down the target of 169 in 16 overs without losing any wickets.
Pre-Game Insights: Pant vs Karthik is India's major selection debate in a contest full of star-studded match-ups.
Jos Buttler is a more accomplished captain, settled in the rigmarole of the job and his tactics.
Virat Kohli has rediscovered his mojo.
England will feel they have an edge of sorts, what with two must-win games ticked off against New Zealand and Sri Lanka to get them out of Group 1.
The shorter square boundaries in Adelaide will play to the strengths of both batting line-ups.
Sam Curran's emergence as Buttler's go-to death bowler will face its sternest test against a side who are striking at 11.90 at the death.
Suryakumar Yadav strides above them all as the man of this World Cup with remarkable numbers - 225 runs at a strike rate of 193.96.
Ben Stokes could play a key role in holding England's batting together in the possible absence of Dawid Malan.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch for Australia vs Afghanistan started off slow and inconsistent in bounce, but it skidded on nicely at night.
India have won their last four bilateral T20I series against England - two in England, two in India, all four by one-match margins.
Virat Kohli needs 42 runs to become the first batter to 4000 in T20Is.
Alex Hales is 13 short of the 2000 mark.
